smile.math.distance

Interface Metric<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Distance<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChebyshevDistance, EditDistance, EuclideanDistance, HammingDistance, JensenShannonDistance, LeeDistance, MahalanobisDistance, ManhattanDistance, MinkowskiDistance, SparseChebyshevDistance, SparseEuclideanDistance, SparseManhattanDistance, SparseMinkowskiDistance

    public interface Metric<T>
extends Distance<T>
    A metric function defines a distance between elements of a set. Besides non-negativity, isolation, and symmetry, it also has to satisfy triangular inequality.
    • non-negativity: d(x, y) ≥ 0
    • isolation: d(x, y) = 0 if and only if x = y
    • symmetry: d(x, y) = d(x, y)
    • triangular inequality: d(x, y) + d(y, z) ≥ d(x, z).
    .

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface smile.math.distance.Distance

        d
